observer
Class WorkspacePublisher

java.lang.Object
  observer.WorkspacePublisher
Direct Known Subclasses:
IDESWorkspace
public class WorkspacePublisher
extends java.lang.Object

A publisher of change notification events in a workspace containing multiple discrete event system models. Stores a collection of WorkspaceSubscribers to which it sends notifications of changes in the workspace.

Author:
Helen Bretzke

Field Summary
private  java.util.ArrayList<WorkspaceSubscriber> subscribers

Constructor Detail

WorkspacePublisher

public WorkspacePublisher()
Creates a workspace publisher with an empty list of subscribers.

Method Detail

addSubscriber

public void addSubscriber(WorkspaceSubscriber subscriber)
Attaches the given subscriber to this publisher. The given subscriber will receive notifications of changes from this publisher.

Parameters:
subscriber -

removeSubscriber

public void removeSubscriber(WorkspaceSubscriber subscriber)
Removes the given subscriber to this publisher. The given subscriber will no longer receive notifications of changes from this publisher.

Parameters:
subscriber -

fireRepaintRequired

public void fireRepaintRequired()
Triggers a notification to all subscribers that a repaint is required.

fireRepaintRequired

protected void fireRepaintRequired(WorkspaceMessage message)
Sends a notification to subscribers of changes to the display options such as Zoom, or toggling show grid, LaTeX rendering, UniformNode size etc. Passes the given message to each subscriber.

Parameters:
message - details of the change notification

fireModelCollectionChanged

protected void fireModelCollectionChanged(WorkspaceMessage message)
Sends notification to subscribers when a DES model is created or opened (added), closed (removed) or renamed.

Parameters:
message -

fireModelSwitched

protected void fireModelSwitched(WorkspaceMessage message)
Sends notification to subscribers of changes to the type of active model e.g. from FSM to petri net. Intended to facilitate changes to the current set of interface tools (a.k.a. work bench) needed to view and manipulate different kinds of DES models.

Parameters:
message -
